intro: Erigeron pacalis, commonly known as the Pacific blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its foliage is generally gray-green with hairy surfaces, adapting to arid environments.
